message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has developed a pulmonary embolism, and the treatment of choice for acute pulmonary embolism is low-molecular weight heparin. Clopidogrel and Ticagrelor are both antiplatelet agents and are not indicated for treating pulmonary embolism. Aspirin is also an antiplatelet agent and is not the first-line treatment for pulmonary embolism.

Low-molecular weight heparin is the preferred initial therapy for pulmonary embolism. Aspirin, Clopidogrel, and Ticagrelor are all antiplatelet agents and do not have a primary role in treating pulmonary embolism.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has signs of pulmonary embolism, which requires anticoagulation therapy. Low-molecular-weight heparin is the preferred anticoagulant for most patients with pulmonary embolism. Clopidogrel and ticagrelor are antiplatelet agents used in the treatment of acute coronary syndromes, but they are not indicated for pulmonary embolism. Aspirin is also an antiplatelet agent and may be used for secondary prevention of thrombotic events, but it is not indicated for acute treatment of pulmonary embolism.
